# Roland Kickinger

| birth_place = Vienna, Austria
| occupation = Actor
| yearsactive = 1997â€“present
| spouse =
| height = 6 ft 4 in
}}
Roland Kickinger (born March 30, 1968)[http://www.bodybuilders.com/roland.htm Bodybuilders.com - Pro Profiles - Roland Kickinger Pro Bodybuilding Profile] is an Austrian actor and bodybuilder from Vienna. Standing 6 ft 4 in tall (1.93 m) and weighing from 250-300 pounds (113 to 136 kg), he has appeared in numerous bodybuilding competitions, fitness magazines and training videos. He is best known for his role in Terminator Salvation.
Acting career
In his acting career, Kickinger is perhaps best known for his regular role as Chip Rommel in the television series Son of the Beach.
Kickinger collaborated with songwriter/guitarist Dale Buchanan to release pop rock music under the band name The Floaters in 2002.
He also played the young version of fellow Austrian-American, Arnold Schwarzenegger, in the 2005 TV movie See Arnold Run, which later led to him appearing in the 2009 film Terminator Salvation as a prototype of the T-800 (with Schwarzenegger's likeness digitally applied over his own). He also had minor roles in the films Street Warrior and Disaster Movie, both released in 2008.
